text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with oven baked onion rings oh
that's right
makin onion rings I was thinking to
myself a chef of your talent creativity
and humility should be able to come up
with an onion ring that's just as good
as a deep fried version and you know
what you can no such thing but these are
pretty good so check it out so I'm just
going to do a small batch here I have
one yellow onion I'm going to cut off
the ends I'm going to peel it and I'm
going to slice this one in like four
slices so those are about a half inch
each maybe three-eighths all right you
try to get them as even as you can and
then of course you're going to separate
the rings and don't forget those little
inside pieces those little small pieces
or just as good all right for the
breading station I'm going to need some
egg but I'm just going to use the egg
white so I'm going to take two egg
whites and I use the old separate it
through your hand method
who is the tough one all right so two
egg whites I'm going to give it a splash
of regular milk whisk that up and I
decided because you know I do that once
in a while I decided to throw in a
little pinch of cayenne for the breading
we're going to use panko it's the really
larger grain flakier crunchy err sharper
edged breadcrumb use panko for this it
just works so much better now I'm going
to throw the onions in a ziploc bag and
I'm going to put in a good amount of
freshly ground
fine fine grain black pepper and then
also finely grained salt normally I use
the larger flake sea salt and coach
yourself for most things here's where
you want to use the regular just fine
grain table salt it's going to coat it
better I'm going to throw in a couple
spoons of regular flour I'm going to do
a little shake make sure they're all
very well coated okay this is an
important step then that's going to go
in your egg white milk mixture don't do
too many at a time I did this in like
four batches so from the egg they go
into the breadcrumb and again you gotta
just be a little careful and make sure
they're all perfectly coated so you can
do with your hands you can just flip the
bowl around whatever and once those are
coated like that one all right you're
going to put them on a sheet pan and if
you want to go real low-cal you don't
have to do this but I think they come
out a lot nicer because we're not going
to fry them if you give them a nice
spray with the vegetable oil or olive
oil and that wasn't even a spray it was
barely a spray it was more like a spritz
than a spray they go in a very hot 450
degree oven for about 12 to 15 minutes
I'm going to guess mine took about 13
minutes and they're crispy the onion is
just cooked it's got a little bit of
texture to it sweet delicious those
panko bread crumbs are really nice and
crunchy with just a minimal amount of
oil and that is a really easy no fuss no
muss no mess onion ring anyway I hope
you give those a try very simple very
easy go to the site the ingredients are
there there was like you know three of
them and as always in
joy
you
